data.title: Hidden Word
data.solution:
key = gets.chomp
message = gets.chomp

puts key.chars.map(&:to_i).zip(message.split).reject{|x,y| x == 0}.map{|x,y| y[x-1]}.join
data.statement:
There is a word hidden in every [[message]].
But the word can only be found when supplied with a [[key]].

A [[key]] composed of digits <<d>>.
The <<i-th>> digit of the [[key]] correspond to the <<i-th>> word of the [[message]].

The hidden word is formed by joining the characters of <<d-th>> position of each word.

Note: 
Positions/digits given are one-based indexing. 
No character is taken from the corresponding word if the digit is 0.

Example:
[[key]] = 12
[[message]] = Hey Hi!

`Hey Hi!``1    2``H    i`
The hidden word is "Hi".

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

There is a word hidden in every message.
But the word can only be found when supplied with a key.

A key composed of digits d.
The i-th digit of the key correspond to the i-th word of the message.

The hidden word is formed by joining the characters of d-th position of each word.

Note:
Positions/digits given are one-based indexing.
No character is taken from the corresponding word if the digit is 0.

Example:
key = 12
message = Hey Hi!

Hey Hi!
1    2
H    i

The hidden word is "Hi".
Input
Line 1: key, as a string of digits d, for the message
Line 2: The message with the hidden word.
Output
Output: The hidden word
Constraints
length of key == number of words in message
Example
Input
12
Hey Hi!
Output
Hi
